intro: Lastrea inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Lastrea inaequalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
